feed.title: NewsTracker: state islamic
feed.subtitle: This is a news tracking demo

entry.title: Pataki: Fighting Islamic State should be higher priority
entry.summary: Former New York Gov. George Pataki is telling Iowans he would make fighting the Islamic State group a higher priority of the federal government by increasing U.S. airstrikes against the violent militant group in the Middle East.

entry.title: Islamic State leader raped American hostage, US finds
entry.summary: The news is but the latest in a litany of horrors perpetrated by the Islamic State group, which has beheaded, burned and crucified male captives while passing around women as sex slaves.

entry.title: Witnesses say Islamic State leader raped American hostage Kayla Mueller, who was later killed
entry.summary: The Islamic State group claimed Mueller was killed in a Jordanian air strike near Raqqah, the group's self-declared capital in Syria.

entry.title: Witnesses say Islamic State leader raped American hostage Kayla Mueller, who was later killed
entry.summary:
Mueller, whose death was reported in February, was held for a time by Islamic State financier Abu Sayyaf and his wife, known as Umm Sayyaf.

Abu Sayyaf was killed in a Delta Force raid of his Syrian compound in June, which resulted in a treasure trove of intelligence about the Islamic State group.

entry.title: Islamic State leader reportedly raped American hostage
entry.summary: The parents of the late American hostage Kayla Mueller say they were told by American officials that their daughter was repeatedly forced to have sex with Abu Bakr Baghdadi, the leader of the Islamic State group.

entry.title: France to rally aid for religious minorities targeted by IS
entry.summary: France is hosting a conference next month to raise money and rally support for Mideast Christians and other minorities persecuted by the Islamic State group.

entry.title: US probes whether Islamic State used chemical weapons
entry.summary: Although the U.S. and its coalition partners are mounting airstrikes against the Islamic State, they are relying on local forces like the Kurds, the Iraqi military and others to do the fighting on the ground.

entry.title: U.S. investigating whether Islamic State used chemical weapons against Kurds
entry.summary: -- The United States is investigating whether the Islamic State used chemical weapons, the White House said Thursday, following allegations that IS militants deployed chemical weapons against Kurdish forces in northern Iraq.

entry.title: Iraq: Islamic State truck bomb kills scores in Baghdad market
entry.summary:
A statement circulated online by supporters of Islamic State said the blast had targeted what it called a stronghold of the "charlatan army" and Shiite Muslim militias.

Security forces and militia groups are fighting Islamic State in Anbar province, the sprawling Sunni heartland in western Iraq.

entry.title: Islamic State truck bombing at Baghdad market kills 67
entry.summary:
The Islamic State group claimed responsibility for the explosion, saying it targeted a gathering place of Shiites and vowed more such attacks.

In a message posted on an IS-affiliated Twitter account, the Islamic State said it detonated a parked explosives-laden truck in order to have the "rejectionists (Shiites) experience the same harm as their bombardments cause to our Muslim people."

entry.title: Islamic State radio says Croatian hostage killed in Egypt
entry.summary: Al-Bayan radio station said Thursday that "soldiers of the Caliphate" killed Tomislav Salopek, "whose country is participating in the war against the Islamic State."

entry.title: Islamic State radio says Croatian hostage killed in Egypt
entry.summary: CAIRO (AP) - The Islamic State group's radio station says its Egyptian affiliate killed a Croatian hostage, the first word from the extremist group a day after a gruesome image of his beheading circulated online.

entry.title: Libyan officials: Islamic State affiliate in Sirte is shelling besieged residential area
entry.summary: BENGHAZI, Libya - Libyan officials and witnesses say the country's Islamic State affiliate has attacked a rival Islamist group in the central city of Sirte and is shelling a residential area.

entry.title: Islamic State Affiliate in Libya Shells Residential Area
Correction: Islamic State story
entry.summary: The Associated Press could not independently verify the image, though it bore markings consistent with the filmed hostage demand released last week by Egypt's Islamic State affiliate, the Sinai Province of the Islamic State.

entry.title: U.S. F-16s fly first sorties from Turkey base against Islamic State targets in Syria
entry.summary:
Pentagon officials have said the main advantage of using Incirlik is its proximity to Islamic State targets in northern Syria, although a senior U.S. defense official said Wednesday that the F-16s may also be used on missions over Iraq.

A Foreign Ministry official in Ankara said Wednesday that Turkey has not carried out its own airstrikes against the Islamic State recently because the U.S. asked it to wait so that the two countries can coordinate efforts.

"More than anybody else in the region, Turkey did not want to tangle with ISIS," he added, using an alternative acronym for the Islamic State group.

entry.title: Islamic State Egypt affiliate claims to have beheaded Croatian hostage: Report [Video]
entry.summary:
The group changed its name from Ansar Bayt al-Maqdis to Sinai Province after it pledged allegiance to Islamic State, which controls large areas of Syria and Iraq.

The photograph, circulating on Twitter accounts of Sinai Province supporters, shows a man's severed head placed on his body, with a knife driven into sand next to it and the black Islamic State flag in the background.

entry.title: Jeb Bush says Hillary Clinton shares blame for Islamic State rise
Online image purports to show Croat killed by Islamic State
entry.summary:
An online image circulated Wednesday purported to show the beheading of a Croatian hostage held by the Islamic State group's Egyptian affiliate, the first such killing of a foreign captive in Egypt since the extremists set up a branch here.

In Libya, an Islamic State affiliate also has beheaded its captives.

entry.title: The Latest on Croatian hostage killed by Islamic State
entry.summary: The latest in the events surrounding the purported slaying by Egypt's Islamic State affiliate of Croatian hostage Tomislav Salopek, after an online image was circulated Wednesday showing his beheaded body.

entry.title: History of the Islamic State group as Croat killed in Egypt
entry.summary: The militants rename themselves the Islamic State group.

entry.title: History of the Islamic State group as Croat killed in Egypt
entry.summary: Jan. 31 - The Islamic State group releases a video saying it beheaded Goto.

entry.title: History of the Islamic State Group as Croat Killed in Egypt
History of the Islamic State group as Croat killed in Egypt
entry.summary:
Oct. 3 - The Islamic State group releases a video showing a jihadi behead British hostage Alan Henning.

Feb. 15 - Libyan militants who earlier pledged their loyalty to the Islamic State group behead a group of Coptic Christians from Egypt in an online video.

entry.title: Islamic State said to have beheaded Croat held in Egypt
entry.summary: A black flag used by the Islamic State group and a knife were planted in the sand next to him.

entry.title: Online image purports to show Croat killed by Islamic State
entry.summary:
The still image, shared by Islamic State sympathizers on social media, showed the apparent body of Tomislav Salopek, a married, 30-year-old father of two, wearing a beige jumpsuit looking like the one he had worn in a previous video.

The photo carried a caption in Arabic that said Salopek was killed "for his country's participation in the war against the Islamic State," and after a deadline had passed for the Egyptian government to meet their demands.

entry.title: Online image purports to show Croatian hostage beheaded by Islamic State affiliate in Egypt
Bush: US may need more troops in Iraq to beat Islamic State
entry.summary: The former Florida governor said the U.S. may need to send more ground troops into Iraq to defeat Islamic State militants, but he stopped short of saying how many as he outlined his strategy for combating a threat that's "spreading like a pandemic."

entry.title: No bail for couple accused of trying to join Islamic State
entry.summary:
Jaelyn Delshaun Young, and Muhammad Oda Dakhlalla, were arrested over the weekend on charges that they were trying to travel abroad to join the Islamic State militant group.

(AP) - A young Mississippi couple who are charged with attempting to join the Islamic State were ordered held without bail Tuesday, pending federal grand jury action on the charges.

entry.title: 2 former students indicted on Islamic State terror charges
entry.summary: NEW YORK (AP) " U.S. authorities say two former New York City college students have been indicted on terror charges accusing them of plotting to help the Islamic State group.

entry.title: 2 Ex-NY Students Indicted on Islamic State Terror Charges
Taliban condemns 'barbarity' of Islamic State execution video
entry.summary:
Kabul: The Taliban condemned a video released this week showing what appeared to be a group of fighters belonging to the radical Islamic State movement killing a group of Afghan prisoners by blowing them up with explosives.

The video, apparently shot in the eastern Afghan province of in June, gave a glimpse into the struggle the Taliban is waging against Islamic State - both considered ultra-hardline groups - for supremacy of the Islamist insurgency in Afghanistan.

Groups associated with Islamic State have made growing inroads in Afghanistan in recent years, attracting fighters and support away from the Taliban by preaching a more extreme form of Islamist militancy.

entry.title: Mississippians charged with trying to join Islamic State
entry.summary: The attorney also said the man's father, Oda H. Dakhlalla, is imam of the Islamic Center of Mississippi in Starkville.

entry.title: The Latest on Islamic State arrests in US: Case stuns family
The Latest: Family is 'stunned' by son's arrest, allegations of trying to join Islamic State
entry.summary: An attorney representing the family of one of two Mississippi residents charged with trying to travel to Syria to join the Islamic State militant group says the family is "absolutely stunned" by the arrest.

entry.title: Syrian hard-line faction backs US-Turkey plans for safe zone
entry.summary: BEIRUT (AP) - A Syrian hard-line Islamic faction has expressed strong support for a U.S.-Turkish plan to set up a safe zone in northern Syria free of the Islamic State group.

entry.title: Bush links Clinton to rise of Islamic State
entry.summary: Bush has yet, either on the campaign trail or in the preview of his Tuesday speech released by his campaign, to say exactly what a U.S.-led campaign against the Islamic State would look like if he is elected president.

entry.title: Bush links Clinton to rise of Islamic State
entry.summary: "The threat of global jihad, and of the Islamic State in particular, requires all the strength, unity and confidence that only American leadership can provide," Bush will say, according to excerpts of his remarks as prepared for delivery.

entry.title: Bush links Clinton to rise of Islamic State
entry.summary:
Both countries tried to negotiate plans to keep at least several thousand U.S. forces in Iraq beyond the deadline to help keep a lid on simmering tensions among Islamic sects.

Since last year, after the Islamic State gained a foothold in Iraq and Syria, Obama has ordered the deployment of about 3,500 American military trainers and advisers who are helping Iraqi forces fight the Islamic State.

entry.title: Charge: 2 Mississippi residents aimed to join Islamic State
entry.summary: Later, the charge says, she told the second FBI agent that Dakhlalla could help with the Islamic State's Internet media, saying he "really wants to correct the falsehoods heard here" and the "U.S. media is all lies when regarding" the group, which she called by its preferred internal name, Dawlah.

entry.title: Charge: 2 Mississippi residents aimed to join Islamic State
entry.summary: Young and another Mississippi resident were arrested on Saturday, Aug. 8, 2015, on charges that they were trying to travel abroad to join the Islamic State militant group.

entry.title: Charge: 2 Mississippi residents aimed to join Islamic State
entry.summary:
In later conversations peppered with Arabic phrases, she said she planned a "nikkah," or Islamic marriage to Dakhlalla so they could travel without a chaperone under Islamic law.

In June, the first FBI agent passed Young off to a second FBI agent posing as an Islamic State facilitator.

entry.title: Charge: 2 Mississippi residents aimed to join Islamic State
entry.summary: JACKSON, Mississippi (AP) " Two Mississippi residents were arrested over the weekend on charges that they were trying to travel abroad to join the Islamic State militant group.

entry.title: California man guilty of trying to support Islamic State
entry.summary:
A California college student who lied on a passport application so he could travel to Syria and join the Islamic State pleaded guilty Monday to a terrorism-related charge.

Adam Dandach, 21, of Orange pleaded guilty to attempting to provide material support to the Islamic State and to lying on a passport application.

He told FBI agents who questioned him at John Wayne Airport that he was heading to Syria and planned to pledge allegiance and offer assistance to the Islamic State.

entry.title: California man guilty of trying to support Islamic State
Feds: Man wanted to form small army for Islamic State
Nusra Front says it will withdraw from frontline against Islamic State in Syria
entry.summary:
The Nusra Front's withdrawal from rural positions north-east of the Syrian city of Aleppo came amid newly announced steps by Turkey and the United States to fight the Islamic State in Syria.

It said that the decision to push the Islamic State out of the proposed safe zone was not "the free choice of the fighting factions; in fact, its first goal is the national security of Turkey."

US and Turkish officials last month described plans to provide military support to Syrian rebels to clear the Islamic State, from a roughly 95-kilometre-long strip of territory along the Turkish border.

entry.title: Islamic State contagion growing in Indonesia
entry.summary:
Islamic State supporter Budi Waluyo (right) with three former Jemaah Islamiah members in front of the al-Fataa mosque in Jakarta.

Fauzan al-Anshori, right, an Islamic State recruiter, leads the "bayat", an oath of devotion, to the leader of Islamic State.

entry.title: Islamic extremists hit Mali hotel; standoff leaves 12 dead
entry.summary: Islamic extremists started the attack Friday at the hotel in Sevare, about 375 miles north of Bamako.

entry.title: Islamic State group's command is dominated by ex-officers from Saddam's military, spy agency
entry.summary: Saddam-era veterans also serve as "governors" for seven of the 12 "provinces" set up by the Islamic State group in the territory it holds in Iraq, the intelligence chief said.

entry.title: IS top command dominated by ex-officers in Saddam's army
entry.summary: An Islamic hard-liner, he once chided Omran for wearing an Iraqi flag pin into the bathroom because it included the words "God is great."

entry.title: IS top command dominated by ex-officers in Saddam's army
entry.summary:
Under its leader, Iraqi jihadi Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, the Islamic State group's top command is dominated by former officers from Saddam's military and intelligence agencies, according to senior Iraqi officers and top intelligence officials.

Now al-Ani is a commander in the Islamic State group, said Omran, who rose to become a major general in the Iraqi army and now commands its 5th Division fighting IS.

But Islamic militants grew in prominence, particularly with the creation and increasing strength of al-Qaida in Iraq.

entry.title: Islamic State 'kidnaps 230 Christians' after Syrian town falls
entry.summary:
Amman: Islamic State militants have captured dozens of Christian families after snatching the regime-held Syrian town of Qaryatain.

Rased News Network, a Facebook page affiliated with Islamic State militants, published this picture showing a militant on a tank captured from Syrian forces in Qaryatain.

Islamic State militants carry weapons as they battle against Syrian government forces in Qaryatain in a photo released by Rased News Network on Facebook.

entry.title: After capturing central Syrian town, Islamic State group abducts dozens of Christians
entry.summary: BEIRUT - Activists say Islamic State group has abducted 230 residents, including dozens of Christians, from a central Syrian town captured by the extremists earlier this week.

entry.title: BREAKING: Jihadi gunmen on motorbikes try to KIDNAP Western tourists in Mali
entry.summary: Mali's north fell under the control of Islamic militants following a military coup in 2012.

entry.title: Jihadists attack hotel in central Mali
entry.summary: BAMAKO, Mali (AP) " Islamic extremists attacked a hotel in central Mali near an army camp in Sevare, an army spokesman said Friday.

entry.title: Islamic State abducts dozens of Christians from Syrian town: monitor
entry.summary: Islamic State militants have abducted dozens of Christian families after seizing a strategically located town in the central Syrian province of Homs, a monitor said on Friday.

entry.title: Islamic State Abducts Dozens Of Syrian Christians
Wife of killed Islamic State leader now in Iraq custody
entry.summary:
Umm Sayyaf, wife of the Islamic State's head of oil operations Abu Sayyaf, was in U.S. custody since May 15.

They said she provided a "trove" of intelligence about Islamic State operations.

entry.title: Libyan judge abducted by Islamic State group found dead in western city
entry.summary:
BENGHAZI, Libya - The body of a Libyan judge abducted last month by an Islamic State affiliate was found on Thursday, Libyan officials said.

Islamic State fighters man checkpoints in the area and have in the past taken non-Muslims or government officials hostage there.

entry.title: New IS affiliate claims responsibility for Saudi bombing
entry.summary:
An alleged new affiliate of the Islamic State group in Saudi Arabia has claimed responsibility for an attack that targeted a mosque used by police special forces in the kingdom's southwest on Thursday, killing 15 people.

It was one of the deadliest attacks in years against Saudi security forces that battled a wave of al-Qaida attacks about a decade ago and which have come under sporadic attacks in recent weeks in the capital, Riyadh, by militants purportedly linked to the Islamic State group.

The claim by the so-called Hijaz Province of the Islamic State appeared hours after the attack in the city of Abha, close to Saudi Arabia's southern border with war-torn Yemen.

Previous attacks in the kingdom by Islamic State militants have been claimed by a group calling itself Najd Province, a reference to Saudi Arabia's central region, where Riyadh is located.

The Islamic State's other affiliate in Saudi Arabia claimed responsibility for a number of attacks in the kingdom in recent months, including various deadly shootings and smaller attacks against police at checkpoints in Riyadh.

entry.title: Islamic State's Egypt affiliate threatens to kill Croatian captive
entry.summary: Islamic State's Egyptian affiliate released a video Wednesday threatening to kill a Croatian hostage in 48 hours if Muslim women aren't released from the country's jails.

entry.title: Radical preacher Anjem Choudary charged with inviting support for ISIS
entry.summary: LONDON - Authorities in Britain are charging two people - including radical preacher Anjem Choudary - with inviting support for the Islamic State group through lectures that were published online.

entry.title: Turkey says 'extensive' fight against IS to start soon
entry.summary: His comments came following reports that members of the Free Syrian Army who went through a U.S. training program to fight Islamic State militants were captured by the al-Qaida-linked Nusra Front in Syria.

entry.title: Facing Islamic State threat, Iraq digitizes national library
Facing Islamic State threat, Iraq digitizes national library
entry.summary: In recent months, the library donated some 2,500 books to libraries in Iraq's Diyala province after Iraqi forces recaptured towns there from Islamic State militants.

entry.title: Facing Islamic State threat, Iraq digitizes national library
entry.summary: As the Islamic State militants now set out to destroy Iraq's history and culture, a major preservation and digitization project is underway in the capital to safeguard a millennia worth of history.

entry.title: Islamic State selling sex slaves, the younger the better, claims UN official
entry.summary:
Yazidi Kurdish women chant slogans against the Islamic State's invasion on Sinjar a year ago.

The official, Zainab Bangura?, said that on a trip to Iraq in April she was given a copy of an Islamic State pamphlet, which included the list, showing that captured children as young as one fetch the highest price.

Yazidi Kurds at a protest in Dohuk, Iraq, against the Islamic State's invasion on Sinjar city a year ago.

Thousands of Yazidi Kurdish women and girls have been sold into sexual slavery and forced to marry Islamic State militants, according to Human Rights organisations, Yazidi activists and observers.

entry.title: Turkey onslaught on Kurds, after Islamic State attack, fuels anger
entry.summary: The PKK is affiliated with, but separate from, Syrian Kurdish fighters allied with the United States in its fight against the Islamic State group.

entry.title: News24.com | FBI: Islamic State sympathiser charged in backpack bomb plot
entry.summary: Among other things, the FBI says Suarez also sought to make an Islamic State recruitment video using a script he wrote himself.

entry.title: Florida man Harlem Suarez charged in alleged backpack bomb plot after FBI sting
entry.summary: According to the criminal complaint, the FBI was alerted to Facebook posts made by Suarez in April of this year in which he expressed his support for Islamic State.

entry.title: Florida man Harlem Suarez charged in alleged backpack bomb plot after FBI sting
entry.summary:
Washington: A Florida man has been charged in an alleged backpack bomb plot he planned to carry out on a public beach in Key West to show his support for the Islamic State militant group, the Department of Justice said on Tuesday.

Numerous young men have been arrested in the United States in recent months, with many plotting 'lone wolf attacks' in support of Islamic State.

entry.title: Iraqi militias train young teens to face the threat of IS
entry.summary: For Iraq's Shiite majority, the war against the Islamic State group - which views them as heretics to be killed - is a life-or-death fight for which the entire community has mobilized.

entry.title: 'I am an American' says man who tried to join Islamic State
'I am an American' says man sentenced to prison for trying to join Islamic state
entry.summary: - A Georgia man who wrote that he was "ready for jihad" before booking a flight overseas to join the Islamic State group has been sentenced to 15 years in federal prison.

entry.title: AP News Guide: Turkish-US deal may have far-reaching effect on Islamic State group, Syrian war
entry.summary:
A 110-kilometer (68-mile) stretch along the Turkish border in Syria is under Islamic State control.

The deal further embroils Turkey, a key NATO ally, in Syria's civil war, and also catapults it into a front-line position in the global war against the Islamic State group.

An Islamic State-free zone along the Syria-Turkish border - through which the group has smuggled foreign fighters, oil and other goods for the past year - would strangle the militants in Syria, weakening the group.

entry.title: Confronting Islamic State's propaganda machine
entry.summary:
You only have to look at Islamic State's intelligent use of propaganda to see what happens when your adversary is crippled by silence, dithering and inaction.

The first priority must be to counter Islamic State's highly effective propaganda machine.

That is why I believe Islamic State's appalling treatment of those under its control will ultimately result in the caliphate breaking up with widespread dissent and resentment spreading within its ranks.

We must make clear that Islamic State's dominance has been achieved through the intimidation of local tribes, who are too afraid to challenge the Islamists' brutal regime, and that its military prowess is bogus, while their actual field losses are significant.

entry.title: Talks with Australia as Indonesia moves to tighten laws against Islamic State
entry.summary:
An estimated 500 Indonesians are thought to have travelled to Iraq and Syria to fight with Islamic State forces, seen here in Iraq.

Expressing sympathy for the Islamic State group could become an offence under Indonesia's proposed laws.

entry.title: At Shiite militia 'summer camps', Iraqi teens and boys undergo training to fight Islamic State
entry.summary: BAGHDAD - In the steamy Baghdad night, sweat poured down the faces of the Iraqi teens as they marched around a school courtyard, training for battle against the Islamic State group.

entry.title: At Shiite militia 'summer camps', Iraqi children undergo training to fight Islamic State
Summer camp for Iraqi Shiite boys: training to fight IS
entry.summary:
The Associated Press has found that militia forces battling the Islamic State group are actively training children under 18 years old.

FILE - In this Sunday, March 15, 2015, file photo, young Shiite volunteer militia fighters pose for a photo before battle against Islamic State fighters in Tikrit, Iraq.

It's yet another way minors are being dragged into Iraq's brutal war as the military, Shiite militias and Kurdish fighters battle to take back territory from Islamic State militants, who seized much of the country's north and west over the past year.

entry.title: At Shiite militia 'summer camps', Iraqi children undergo training to fight Islamic State
entry.summary: BAGHDAD - A quiet middle-class Shiite neighborhood in western Baghdad was transformed recently into a mini-boot camp, training teenagers for battle against the Islamic State group.

entry.title: NATO holding rare emergency meeting to review Islamic State threat, Turkey's reaction
entry.summary: "The rise of Islamic State in northern Iraq, in northern Syria, has effectively destabilized the southern border of Turkey. But also domestically, the threat of terrorism has become very real," Lete told The Associated Press.

entry.title: U.S., Turkey plan to carve out 'Islamic State-free zone' in Syria
entry.summary:
The Syrian Kurds are among the most effective ground forces battling the Islamic State group and have been aided by U.S.-led airstrikes, but Turkey fears they could revive an insurgency against Ankara in pursuit of an independent state.

The PKK is fighting Islamic State "for power, not for peace, not for security."

The Turkish leader also said Turkey's action against Islamic State has "changed the regional game."

entry.title: Indonesia, Britain to step up joint efforts to fight Islamic State
entry.summary: JAKARTA, Indonesia -- Indonesia and Britain agreed Monday to step up joint efforts to fight terrorism and the Islamic State group.

entry.title: Q&A: Kurds fight Islamic State and endure Turkish attacks
entry.summary: Tensions flared again after an Islamic State suicide bombing in the southeastern Turkish city of Suruc last week killed 32 people.

entry.title: Q&A: Kurds fight Islamic State and endure Turkish attacks
entry.summary: BAGHDAD (AP) - U.S. and Turkish plans to create an "Islamic State-free zone" in Syria along the Turkish border could escalate the conflict between Turkey and Kurdish fighters in Syria and Iraq.

entry.title: US, Turkey seek to establish Islamic State-free zone
entry.summary: The United States and Turkey are finalizing plans for a military campaign to push the Islamic State out of a strip of land along the Syrian border, deepening efforts to halt the extremists' advances.

entry.title: US, Turkey seek to establish Islamic State-free zone
entry.summary:
The discussions come amid a major tactical shift in Turkey's approach to the Islamic State.

Despite the U.S. and Turkey's shared interests in fighting the Islamic State, the Turks have also prioritized defeating Syrian President Bashar Assad.

entry.title: US, Turkey seek to establish Islamic State-free zone
entry.summary: A U.S. official said the creation of an "Islamic State-free zone" would ensure greater security and stability in the Turkish-Syrian border region.

entry.title: Iraqi officials: Iraqi forces retake Anbar University from IS group
entry.summary:
BAGHDAD - Iraqi officials in Iraq's western Anbar province say government forces have retaken Anbar University from the Islamic State militant group after hours of fierce clashes.

Another Anbar councilman, Faleh al-Issawi, tells The Associated Press that about two dozen Islamic State fighters were killed in the clashes.

The Iraqi military launched a large scale operation this month to retake Anbar province, in which most of the biggest cities are held by the Islamic State group.

entry.title: Turkey threatens more air strikes in Syria, Iraq against Islamic State, PKK
entry.summary: Backed by the US-led coalition air strikes against Islamic State, the YPG controls as much as half of Syria's 800-kilometre border with Turkey, and Ankara is determined to prevent the Kurds creating an independent state in the north of Syria.

entry.title: Q&A: Kurds fight Islamic State and endure attacks
Embattled Kurds fight the IS group while dreaming of independence and enduring Turkish attacks
entry.summary: They have demonstrated a surprising resilience in their fight against Islamic State group militants in Kobani, pushing them out in January with the help of U.S.-led airstrikes.

entry.title: Kurds fight the IS group while being bombed by Turkey
entry.summary:
The Kurds of Syria and Iraq have become a major part of the war against the Islamic State group, with Kurdish populations in both countries threatened by the militants' advance.

Kurds accused Turkey of not doing enough to help Syrian Kurds during the battle against Islamic State militants over the Syrian Kurdish border town of Kobani, prompting violent clashes and straining the fragile peace process.

entry.title: Kurds fight the IS group while being bombed by Turkey
entry.summary: They have been somewhat effective in limiting the expansion of the Islamic State militants across northern Iraq but there are concerns that Turkish airstrikes on the PKK could jeopardize Kurdish positions.

entry.title: Turkish jets target Kurds in Iraq, Islamic State militants in Syria
entry.summary: Turkey also announced Friday that it was allowing its air bases to be used by the U.S.-led coalition forces for operations against Islamic State extremists.

entry.title: Palestinian official assassinated in refugee camp in Lebanon, likely by Islamic extremists
Palestinian official assassinated in refugee camp in Lebanon
entry.summary: Lebanese security officials say Islamic extremists in the camp were likely behind the assassination Saturday.

entry.title: Turkish jets strike Kurds in Iraq, Islamic State in Syria
entry.summary:
The strikes in Iraq targeted the Kurdistan Workers' Party, or PKK, whose affiliates have been effective in battling the Islamic State group.

The statement did not specify Islamic State targets that were struck in Syria in a second night of bombings, but described the airstrikes in both Syria and Iraq as being "effective."

Kurdish groups held the Turkish government responsible for the blast, saying it had not been aggressive in battling the Islamic State group.

entry.title: Turkish jets strike Kurds in Iraq, Islamic State in Syria
entry.summary: Turkish police meanwhile proceeded with a major operation against the Islamic State, the PKK and the far-left DHKP-C for a second day running.

entry.title: Turkish jets strike Kurds in Iraq, Islamic State in Syria
entry.summary:
Turkish warplanes struck Islamic State group targets across the border in Syria early Friday, in a strong tactical shift for Turkey which had long been reluctant to join the U.S.-led coalition against the extremist group.

Turkish jets struck camps belonging to Kurdish militants in northern Iraq, authorities said Saturday, the first strike since a 2013 peace deal as Ankara also bombed Islamic State positions in Syria.

On Friday, three F-16 jets struck Islamic State targets that included two command centers and a gathering point near the Turkish border in Syria.

entry.title: Australian Islamic State group medic arrested on return home
entry.summary:
He is the first Australian involved with the Islamic State known to have returned home since the Sunni fighters swept into western Iraq in June last year and declared the establishment of a caliphate, Monash University terrorism expert Greg Barton said.

Court documents show both charges allege that Brookman knowingly provided support to the Islamic State movement by undertaking guard duty and reconnaissance for the militants.

Barton said it was unclear whether Brookman was ever in al-Raqqa, although he admits to being in a town controlled by the Islamic State.

He said he was innocent of any crime and was forced to join Islamic State militants after being injured in an airstrike and taken to a hospital controlled by the group at al-Bab in Aleppo province.

entry.title: Australian Islamic State group medic arrested on return home
entry.summary: It is not clear whether Brookman was still in Syria on Dec. 4, when Australia made a presence in the Islamic State stronghold of al-Raqqa province in Syria a crime punishable by 10 years in prison.

entry.title: Australian Islamic State group medic arrested in Sydney
entry.summary: Brookman says he was forced to join Islamic State militants after being injured in an airstrike and taken to a hospital controlled by the group.

entry.title: Australian Islamic State group medic arrested in Sydney
entry.summary: An Australian nurse who says he was forced by the Islamic State movement to work as a medic in Syria is to appear in a Sydney court on terrorism-related charges.

entry.title: In shift, Turkish jets strike Islamic State targets in Syria
entry.summary: Turkish aircraft dropped four precision-guided bombs on three Islamic State targets in the early hours Friday and were reported launching fresh attacks late Friday night.

entry.title: Turkish jets bomb Islamic State militants, marking pivotal shift and end of tacit truce
entry.summary:
That gave Islamic State cover to continue building its network in the country.

Officials say the mass arrests reflect careful monitoring of IS's followers over a long time, but the scale of detentions also underscores how broad Turkey has allowed the Islamic State network to become.

entry.title: Turkish bombing of Islamic State marks end of tacit truce
entry.summary: On Thursday, as Turkey's government tried to counter criticism over the suicide bombing, Islamic State struck again, this time in an ambush along the border that left a Turkish soldier dead.

entry.title: Turkish bombing of Islamic State marks end of tacit truce
entry.summary:
ISTANBUL (AP) - Last month, the first edition of the Islamic State group's Turkish-language magazine contained not a word of criticism of the Turkish government.

Turkey has started to crack down on the group under Western pressure and Islamic State now sees Turkey as the enemy, raising the stakes in the struggle against the extremist network.

Islamic State - also known by acronyms ISIS and ISIL - has spent years building its network inside Turkey, even as Turkish security services monitored the group to glean valuable intelligence.

entry.title: Turkish bombing of Islamic State marks end of tacit truce
entry.summary: The abrupt shift in Islamic State's Turkish propaganda magazine shows just how quickly a tacit truce has come apart.

entry.title: In shift, Turkish jets strike Islamic State targets in Syria
Turkish jets strike several Islamic State targets in Syria
entry.summary: For their part, Turkish police launched a major operation Friday against terror groups including Islamic State, carrying out simultaneous raids in Istanbul and 12 provinces and detaining more than 290 people.

entry.title: Iraqi top Shiite cleric urges Baghdad to protect families of troops battling Islamic State
entry.summary: BAGHDAD - Iraq's top Shiite cleric has called on the government in Baghdad to do all it can to protect the families of Iraqi forces fighting the Islamic State group, saying they are an "easy prey" for extremists bent on revenge attacks.

entry.title: Turkey launches fight against Islamic State and allows US warplanes to use bases for airstrikes
entry.summary: Turkey, a vital conduit for the Islamic State's power base in Syria, had come under increased criticism for its inability - or unwillingness - to halt the flow of foreign fighters and supplies across its 804-kilometre border.

entry.title: Turkey allows US to use key air base to strike Islamic State
entry.summary: The U.S. and Western countries have long been pressing Erdogan's government to do more to stop foreign fighters from crossing through Turkey into Syria and Iraq to join IS, with some analysts suggesting Turkey was looking the other way because the Islamic State is also fighting Assad.

entry.title: Turkey allows US to use key air base to strike Islamic State
entry.summary: On Friday, Turkey's state-run television reported that Turkish warplanes struck Islamic State group targets across the border in Syria.

entry.title: Turkey scrambles jets to Syrian border after clash with Islamic State: official
entry.summary: ANKARA Turkey has scrambled fighter jets to the Syrian border following clashes with Islamic State militants, a Turkish official said on Thursday.

entry.title: Official: Suspected IS militants kill Turkish soldier
entry.summary: The attack has been blamed on militants linked to the Islamic State group and came amid a clamp down by Turkey on the extremist group.

entry.title: Official: Suspected IS militants kill Turkish soldier
entry.summary: Suspected Islamic State militants fired at a Turkish military outpost from inside Syrian territory Thursday, killing a Turkish soldier and wounding two others, an official said.

entry.title: Drones and ditches as Turkey tightens border after Islamic State bombing
entry.summary: Turkey's NATO allies have long expressed concern about control of its border with Syria which in parts runs directly parallel with territory controlled by Islamic State.

entry.title: FBI Director: Islamic State group's inspiration is now biggest terror threat to US homeland
entry.summary: Asked if the threat from the Islamic State group had eclipsed that of the rival organization that attacked the U.S. on September 11, 2001, Comey said, "Yes."

entry.title: FBI chief: Islamic State group bigger threat than al-Qaida
entry.summary:
Comey spoke July 22 on the threat posed to the U.S. by the Islamic State Group at the Aspen Security Conference in Aspen, Colo.

Comey noted that "the people the Islamic State is trying to reach are people that al-Qaida would never use as an operative, because they are often unstable, troubled drug users."

entry.title: FBI chief: Islamic State group bigger threat than al-Qaida
entry.summary:
ASPEN, Colorado (AP) - The Islamic State group's effort to inspire troubled Americans to violence has become more of a terror threat to the U.S. than an external attack by al-Qaida, the FBI director said Wednesday.

Comey has sounded the alarm about domestic radicalization before, but his remarks Wednesday signal a deepening concern among U.S. officials about the impact of the Islamic State's effort to inspire terrorist violence.

entry.title: Suruc suicide bomber identified as Turk with possible Islamic State ties
entry.summary:
"The investigation is ongoing, but we have evidence that the suspect was linked to Daesh," the official said, speaking on a condition of anonymity in line with government protocol, using an Arabic acronym for the Islamic State.

Kobane was recently the scene of fierce fighting between the Islamic State and Kurdish fighters, and the militants lost control of the town in January.

entry.title: UN envoy warns that lack of funding for aid may be driving Iraqis to Islamic State extremists
entry.summary: Jan Kubis told the U.N. Security Council Wednesday that the United Nations is very worried at reports that desperate Iraqis are turning to the militant Islamic group, which controls about a third of the country.

entry.title: Kurdish militants kill two Turkish police to avenge Islamic State bombing
entry.summary:
Many of Turkey's Kurds and opposition supporters suspect President Tayyip Erdogan and the ruling AK Party of covertly backing Islamic State against Kurdish fighters in Syria, something the government has repeatedly denied.

Anti-government protests after Monday's bombing in Suruc erupted in several cities for a second night on Tuesday, with some of the demonstrators chanting "Murderer Islamic State, collaborator Erdogan and AKP".

On Tuesday, Prime Minister Ahmet Davutoglu rejected accusations that Turkey had tacitly supported Islamic State and had unwittingly opened the door to the bombing; but he said initial evidence suggested the Islamist radical group was responsible.

entry.title: Kurdish militants kill two Turkish police to avenge Islamic State bombing
entry.summary:
Ankara: Kurdish militants have claimed responsibility for the assassination of two Turkish police officers in what they said was retaliation for a suspected Islamic State suicide bombing that killed 32 people.

"He was active in a Syria-linked group supporting the Islamic State. We know that he went to Syria illegally. It was not possible to track him during his time there," the official said, speaking on condition of anonymity because of the sensitivity of the investigation.

entry.title: Man charged with supporting Islamic State pleads not guilty
entry.summary: Authorities say Al-Ghazi, formerly Robert McCollum, pledged his support online to the Islamic State group and tried to recruit others to join the cause.

entry.title: Bombing shows Turkey a vulnerable target for Islamic State
entry.summary:
Officials have raised concerns that a deadly bombing in southeastern Turkey is part of a campaign of retaliation by the Islamic State group for a recent crackdown on its operations in the country.

The country shares a 1,250-kilometer (775-mile) border with Iraq and Syria, putting it nearby to strongholds of the self-proclaimed Islamic State.

He vowed to go after those behind the bombing and made clear he believes it was the Islamic State.

Some analysts say that because of Turkey's aggressive policies against Syrian President Bashar Assad in that country's civil war, it has allowed militants of many stripes to operate in Turkey, providing cover to the Islamic State group.

Social media affiliated with the Islamic State group have been conspicuously silent.

entry.title: UK officials charge 2 men with trying to join Islamic State
entry.summary: LONDON (AP) - British prosecutors have charged two men with trying to join the Islamic State extremist group in Syria.

entry.title: Turkey denies turning blind eye to Islamic State as bombing stokes anger
entry.summary:
Thousands of foreign fighters have crossed through Turkey to join Islamic State over the past few years, fuelling accusations from the government's opponents that it is turning a blind eye.

Authorities have carried out a string of raids in recent weeks to arrest Islamic State suspects.

They have also blocked more than half a dozen Islamist news websites, prompting one group claiming allegiance to Islamic State to accuse Turkey of persecuting Muslims and declare: "Muslims might retaliate."

The Kurdistan Workers Party (PKK) militant group, which has waged a three-decade insurgency against the Turkish state, said the AK Party bore responsibility for the bombing, accusing it of backing Islamic State against Syria's Kurds.

entry.title: Turkey suicide bombing suspect identified
entry.summary: Ahmet Davutoglu said authorities are probing the international and domestic connections of a specific person they believe was a suicide bomber tied to the Islamic State group.

entry.title: Immigration complaint filed against Oregon imam
entry.summary: As the longtime leader at Portland's largest mosque, Masjed As-Saber, Kariye is a well-known figure in the city's Islamic community.

entry.title: US authorities allege Oregon imam concealed associations with radical Islamic groups
entry.summary: - U.S. authorities are seeking to revoke the citizenship of an Oregon imam who they say tried to conceal past associations with radical Islamic groups.

entry.title: Suspected Islamic State suicide bomber kills 30 in Suruc, Turkey
entry.summary:
Turkey's NATO allies have been seeking tighter controls on a porous border with Syria that runs alongside Islamic State-held territories.

The protesters blamed the Suruc blast on lax government action on Islamic State.

Turkey's Kurds have been enraged by what they see as the AKP party government's failure to do more to stop Islamic State.

entry.title: Suspected Islamic State suicide bomber kills 30 in Suruc, Turkey
entry.summary: The PKK held Ankara responsible for Monday's attack, saying it had "supported and cultivated" Islamic State against the Kurds.

entry.title: Suspected Islamic State suicide bombing kills 28 in Turkish border town
entry.summary: A second official also said Islamic State appeared to have been responsible and that the attack was a "retaliation for the Turkish government's efforts to fight terrorism".

entry.title: Suspected IS suicide bombing kills 27 in Turkish border town
entry.summary:
"Our initial evidence shows that this was a suicide attack by Islamic State," one senior official in Ankara told Reuters.

Kobani was the site of one of the biggest battles against Islamic State last year.

Syrian Kurdish forces, known as the YPG, drove the Islamic militants back from the town with the help of U.S. air strikes, after months of fighting and siege.

Turkey's Kurds were enraged at the time by Ankara's refusal to intervene to stop the Islamic State siege.

entry.title: In an Islamic State camp, children told: Behead the doll
entry.summary: The caliphate is an historic form of Islamic rule that the group claims to be reviving with its own radical interpretation, though the vast majority of Muslims reject its claims.

entry.title: In an IS training camp, children told: Behead the doll
entry.summary: A Syrian preacher, right, gives religious lessons to young Syrians April 19 at an Islamic teaching center designed to counter Islamic State group indoctrination, near the Turkish-Syrian border city of Sanliurfa, southern Turkey.

entry.title: US-led airdrops shower leaflets over Islamic State territory
entry.summary: No one has claimed responsibility for the attacks, but the Islamic State militant group often is behind such attacks in and around the capital as it seeks to destabilize Iraq's Shiite-led government.

entry.title: In an IS training camp, children told: Behead the doll
entry.summary:
Then they were lined up, more than 120 of them, and given their next lesson by their Islamic State group instructors: Behead the doll.

In refugee camps, on streets and in mosques, children have become prime targets for the Islamic State group's outreach and propaganda.

He explained how more than 120 children inside the camp had to line up and they were each given a doll and a sword, waiting for their next lesson by their Islamic State group instructors: Behead the doll.

entry.title: At training camp, children told to behead dolls as Islamic State militants mold new generation
At training camp, children told to behead dolls as Islamic State militants mold new generation
entry.summary: When Islamic State extremists overran Yazidi towns in northern Iraq last year, they butchered older men and enslaved many of the women and girls.

entry.title: In an IS training camp, children told: Behead the doll
entry.summary: SANLIURFA, Turkey (AP) - The children had all been shown videos of beheadings and told by their trainers with the Islamic State group that they would perform one someday.

entry.title: US-led airdrops shower leaflets over Islamic State territory
entry.summary: One previous had a cartoon showing masked Islamic State extremists at a "hiring office" feeding people into a meat grinder.

entry.title: Explosions hit Hamas, Islamic Jihad cars in Gaza
US-led airdrops shower leaflets over Islamic State territory
entry.summary:
BEIRUT (AP) - A U.S.-led coalition dropped new leaflets over the de facto capital of the Islamic State group in Syria, promising those below that "freedom will come" to the region, activists said Sunday.

An anti-Islamic State group called Raqqa is Being Silently Slaughtered and the Britain-based Syrian Observatory for Human Rights said the leaflets had drawings showing dead extremists and their flag turned upside down.

entry.title: Egypt's military spokesman says 7 soldiers killed in Sinai
entry.summary: CAIRO (AP) " Egypt's military spokesman says the death toll from the Sinai Peninsula a day earlier has climbed to seven soldiers after a series of Islamic-State claimed attacks.

entry.title: Algerian army confirms 9 soldiers killed in militant ambush
entry.summary: Algeria has been fighting Islamic radicals, largely in remote areas, since the 1990s.

entry.title: Algerian army confirms 9 soldiers killed in militant ambush
entry.summary: The Friday forest ambush blamed on Islamic extremists in the rugged Ain Defla province southwest of the capital of Algiers comes after a string of successes by the army against the country's long-running insurgency.

entry.title: Iraq restructures Diyala police after Islamic State bombing
entry.summary: BAGHDAD (AP) - Two police officials in Iraq's eastern Diyala province say authorities are restructuring a town's police department after an Islamic State-claimed truck bombing there killed 115 people.

entry.title: US-backed offensive against Islamic State in Iraq stutters
entry.summary:
In this photo from a militant website, "lion cubs" hold rifles and Islamic State flags as they exercise at a training camp in Tal Afar, near Mosul in northern Iraq.

At a White House news conference on Wednesday, Mr Obama said his goals for the end of his term in 2017 include ensuring "that we are on track to defeat [Islamic State], that they are much more contained and we're moving in the right direction there".

entry.title: Tennessee shooting suspect texted friend link to Islamic verse before attack [Video]
entry.summary: The night before the attack, Wednesday, Abdulazeez sent the text message with the link to a Hadith, or Islamic teaching, a move that the friend said was unusual.

entry.title: Saudi Arabia says arrests 431 Islamic State suspects, thwarts bombings
entry.summary: DUBAI Saudi Arabia has arrested 431 people suspected of belonging to Islamic State cells and thwarted attacks on mosques, security forces and a diplomatic mission, the interior ministry said on Saturday.

entry.title: Saudi Arabia arrests more than 430 Islamic State suspects
entry.summary: Saudi Arabia has arrested 431 people suspected of belonging to Islamic State (IS) militant group cells, the interior ministry says.

entry.title: Saudi Arabia arrests 400 suspected of links to Islamic State
entry.summary: Saudi Arabia said Saturday it broke up planned Islamic State attacks in the kingdom, announcing it has arrested over 400 people in its raids.

entry.title: Saudi Arabia says it stopped Islamic State attacks; 400 held
entry.summary: Saudi Arabia branded the Islamic State group a terrorist organization last year and has joined the U.S.-led coalition targeting it in Syria and Iraq.

entry.title: Anger in Iraq after suicide attack on marketplace kills 115
entry.summary:
The U.S. and a coalition of nations have been conducting airstrikes on Islamic State positions in Iraq and Syria since last year, but it has not stopped the group from making advances.

There have been several allegations that the Islamic State group has used chlorine previously in both Iraq and Syria.

entry.title: Islamic State suicide attack on Iraq marketplace kills 115
entry.summary:
The attack by the Islamic State group on a crowded marketplace in Iraq's eastern Diyala province has killed over 100 people in one of the deadliest single attacks in the country in the past decade.

Diyala, which borders Iran, is the only province in Iraq where Iranian jets are known to have conducted airstrikes against the Islamic State group earlier this year.

Meanwhile, reports emerged Saturday that the Islamic State group used projectile-delivered poison gas against Kurdish forces in Iraq and Syria on several occasions last month.

entry.title: Islamic State suicide attack on Iraq marketplace kills 115
entry.summary: The Islamic State group, which controls a third of Syria and Iraq in its self-declared caliphate, has not commented on the claims.

entry.title: Islamic State group used poison gas projectiles in attacks: monitors
entry.summary:
The Islamic State (IS) group used poison gas projectiles in attacks against Kurdish-controlled areas of Syria and Iraq in late June, Kurdish militia backed by UK groups monitoring the Syrian conflict have said.

The Nusra Front, Al Qaeda's affiliate in the Syrian war, has previously accused the Islamic State group of setting a booby trap using barrels of chlorine.

entry.title: ISIL claims suicide car bomb that kills more than 100 in Iraq
entry.summary: More than 100 people were killed in a suicide car bombing at a busy market in an Iraqi town on Friday, in one of the deadliest attacks carried out by Islamic State in Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) fighters since they overran large parts of the country.

entry.title: Islamic State ordered failed jihadist attack on France military: prosecutor
entry.summary:
Paris: A thwarted attack on a French naval site that was to include the beheading of the base's chief officer followed a direct order from a Syria-based member of Islamic State to "hit France", the Paris prosecutor said on Friday.

The three suspects consumed Islamic State propaganda on the internet and "Ismael K" had direct exchanges with an unnamed member of the group in Syria, the prosecutor's statement said.
